content.detailedDescription: Leaving lowes store i saw a ufo over the marine corp base (camp pendleton) bright white fireball coming from sky and looked like it was going to crash but i never saw a bright light coming from area just disapeared i got a weird sensation to look up and catched it.
content.summary: Fireball bright white at a high rate of speed

content.detailedDescription:
I have not been able to dismiss or forget this event--it keeps replaying in my head. finally, some two months later, i visited this website to determine whether anyone else had reported something akin to it. i was shocked to see how many people indeed reported having seen someting very similar to what i saw on the evening on 9.19.09 in the sky over central nj. 
i had been debating with myself and trying to dismiss or rationally explain away what i saw, yet nothing seemed to make sense. now that i realize i wasn't the only one seeing strange things i will share what i saw that night, and yet still can't explain... 
it was sometime after dinner--i don't know exactly what time, but surely early evening. i was out on my second-story deck, entertaining a family of four who had come to visit. they all sat on the floor in a loose circle around me. i was also sitting on the deck floor with my back against the house wall, facing them. as i was speaking to my friends i could see the broad night sky over their heads. it was a spectacularly clear evening; i was enjoying the view. suddenly i saw a very bright, white light in the south-eastern quadrant of the sky. it was approximately at a 45 degree angle in the arc between ground and zenith. i felt perplexed, for though i had been continuously viewing the sky while speaking, i had not noticed this light gradually enter my field of vision, as a plane would have done. i dismissed this as being due to distraction, but it still didn't seem right. that bright spotlight seemed to have simply appeared out of nowhere. being a former small-plane sport pilot, and avid plane spotter, i presumed it was an airliner flying below cruising altitude, perhaps heading into newark liberty international airport, which is a 30 min. drive north of here on us rt. 1. i thought that it was now coincidentally turning its landing lights into my line of sight. a plane coming at you in this fashion often seems to hang still in the sky for a some seconds, so i made no bones about the fact that it seemed to be stationary. then i thought it might be a helicopter hovering in place, though had that been the case i should have been able to also hear its rotors. yet there was no sound whatsoever coming from it. my friends were not aware of what was happening in the sky behind them. suddenly the light flared intensely. at that very moment it also generated a very bright, long, inverted-v shaped beam down towards the ground. what i first thought was a white cloud simultaneously materialized out of thin air and enshrouded this beam of light, which in turn brightly illuminated the swirling "cloud." at that moment i interrupted myself and cried out loud, as i pointed to it, "whoa! what the hell is that?!" my four friends instantly turned their heads around and glanced up, but the railing obstructed their view. anyway, the event was over. seeing nothing, they said nothing, and turned right back to me. i shrugged my shoulders and sputtered something about a strange airplane light and went on talking. still trying to dismiss this event as local air-traffic, i kept my eyes glued to the region in the sky where this had all just happened. the very local "cloud" of mist or smoke or whatnot lingered for many minutes afterwards, making me even more uncomfortable, as i could not explain any of this to myself. had it drifted into view due to winds, why was it so still now? at the time there was no other speck of cloud or mist in the sky, nor had there been any before. in any case, this white "cloud" clearly had been almost wrapped around the light source and its beam in a very strange fashion. i am still baffled.
content.summary: Big, super-bright white light sends a beam downwards in an enveloping mist

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from work when i saw an object coming towards me. it was very foggy and i could see it going in and out of the fog, a few hundred feet up in the air. to be honest it could have been an aircraft from moody air force base, but it looked pretty weird. i've lived here my whole life, about 15 minutes from the base and haven't seen anything like this. as it approached i came to a stop in the middle of the road, trying to see more of it. it passed over my car and zig zagged slowly into the opposite direction. i hesitated and thought about following it but didn't. it was moving slow enough that i felt like i might be able to follow it. i thought it could have been a helicopter but it was silent and had too many lights, on 4 corners. i wish i could describe it further but i don't remember the details. it happened really fast and i didn't have a good look with it passing over.
content.summary: Diamond shaped, slow moving, blinking, parallel with road.

content.detailedDescription: I got out of bed to get a drink of water, then opened the window to let in some cool evening air. i noticed what a beautiful, clear night it was and how well you could see the stars in the sky. looking across the night sky ,i saw three stars in a perfect line perhaps two fingers between each and wondered as to what constellation i might be obvserving. the three stars were all stationary for at least 30 seconds. at that point the center of the three stars seemed to start moveing. at first very slowly (at this point i began to wonder was it actually moving or was it my immagination?) after three or four more seconds of watching it, not totally sure if it was moving or not, it began to speed up.Eventually to about 4 times faster than any of the commercial jets that fly over our home. i watched it move in a straight line across the sky. i ran to the other side of the house to keep watching but it had allready distanced itself from view. i have no idea what i saw, but i felt kind of lucky in a way to have seen something so interesting. i cant stop thinking about what it could have been. each time i think about what i saw that night, a warm smile appears upon my face. i truely believe that i saw something very special. i have seen meteorites,comets,cloud punches,and many other oddities in the sky, but truly this was the most amazing thing that i have ever seen. if you think thier is a simple explanation of what i might have seen, please let me know. the truth of what i saw is all i seek. i have allways had an open mind about the possibilties that are out there. my father was in the air force in england in ww2 and saw or heard some amazing things which he "hinted" to me about, but said he could not tell me any more when i questioned him on it. i found out later in life that he was describing what they call "foo fighters" and such. one night, while dad and i looked up at a beautiful night sky, he asked me if i thought that there was intelligent life up there. without hesitating i responded "absolutely". he asked why i thought that. i told him "well there isnt any down here, there has got to be some somewhere". he grinned and shook his head in agreement. i think he might have allready known it. as much as i am a dreamer and a romantic, i still have an extremely analytical mind. i question everything and everyone, incuding myself on occasion. my heroes growing up were davinci and giordono bruno; because they told the truth at whatever the cost! please continue your wonderful work, and thank you very much for your time. terry
content.summary: Looking at tha night sky, saw three stars, after 30 seconds, one began to start moving slowly then very rapidly

content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside having a cigarette when i noticed the object in the sky. i first thought it was a silver childrens balloon but this object had much more mass to it. it didn't have the flight characteristics of a balloon. it definitely wasn't "floating" in wind currents, it seemed to be moving in a "purposful trajectory". it was a trapezoidal shaped silver object about the size of a small car at 1500 ft moving at about 80-100 mph from east to west. couldn't tell if it had lights or if the flashes were from the reflection of the sunlight. object had no control surfaces or rotors. no visible means of propulsion. the object was spinning horizontally with reference to the ground and emitted no noise. there was no wind on the ground and am unsure what the winds were at 1500 feet. the whole event lasted about 3-4 minutes.
content.summary: Trapezoidal shaped silver object about the size of a small car at 1500 ft

content.detailedDescription:
I was watching sky and this object flew forward and then backward.
as it moved backward i took a photo and it was lighting 3 bulbs under itself.
suddenly it became brighter, when i took a photo i could see 6 light bulbs under it.
i was chasing it in my car, i drove to where it headed backward and i couldn't see it.
i decided to go back home, which is the forward direction of that object and i found it agin flying foward.
i followed it and the object stopped and lighted just one light, blinking and it looked just like a star, a blinking star.
i watched it for 5 minutes and it didnot move so i thought it might be a star, and then it suddenly turned on the light bulbs again and moved to north east, i think.
content.summary: 6 light bulbs under it, moving forward an backward, stationary, and moving again.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving out of the city when i noticed a string of multi-colored lights, which were not flashing, low in the night sky. it appeared to be traveling slowly, quickly changed position in the sky and was difficult to follow. at first i thought it might be a radio tower although this is a road i have traveled thousands of times and knew there wasn't anything like that in that area. also the string of colored lights were at a 20-30 degree angle. when i was able to get to an area not as well lit with lights, i noted a faint outline of what appeared to be a triangular shape. i did see a single white light that was flashing like you would see with an airplane. i live near an army instillation and am used to seeing flying planes at night. i have never seen this type of light configuration and the shape. does anyone have any idea if this is a ufo or just a plane?
content.summary: Straight row of lights, faint triangular shape in dark star-lit night

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving home from the town of lake elsinore.  turned up country club drive from lakeshore drive toward eastern hills.  we have a lot of air traffic here because of near-by airport/sky-diving, hang-gliding, balloonists, private planes, military planes and copters etc., activities so, i'm very aware of what's in our sky.  looked up and noticed bright silvery, shiny oval quite a distance up and high in sky.  i slowed down and stopped to have a better look because object was not typically shaped. no wings, no tail, no sound. was not the usual "sky stuff" we see here.
 
watched object for a few seconds as it sharply bobbed up and down while steadily moving toward the south-east. i turned away briefly, looked back and it had completely disappeared. eastern sky view is open to view planes for a long way out but there was no hint of the silver object. 

i continued on toward my home thinking.. "i believe i just saw a ufo".  parked car approximately one minute later.  went out back to search sky some more for object.  found nothing as i viewed the entire eastern sky.  object had been traveling silently toward the south-east. almost looked like who ever was piloting the object was moving it up and down as they flew along.  what i mean is, a plane just moves along in a straight line.  this object sort of "played" as it flew.
content.summary: Saw shiny silvery object in eastern sky

content.detailedDescription: I was heading home to winchester indiana on sr32 on the east side of muncie and as i looked up in the air to the north of muncie i saw to very shiny silver objects close together. one of the objects took on a more western heading and i lost sight of it but the other remained in view for a few minutes before i was out of viewing range. at first i thought it was just a jet but after watching it for a while i could tell that it was not moving like a jet at all but it seemed to be travelling at a slower rate of speed. also, it was leaving no contrail whatsoever and it appeared to be at a similar altitude as what you expect a jet to be at. the object appeared to round or its reflection would lead to that assumption. one thing i know is that it was not a commercial jet airliner. it was unlike anything i had ever seen before. again, it rate of travel was unlike anything i have ever seen. eerie to say the least.
content.summary: While traveling east on sr32 out of muncie i witnessed an object in the sky i have never seen before.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
I went out on my deck,which overlooks 1+ acres of woods in sunurb of burnsville,off burnsville pkwy and cty rd 5 at about midnight. between the treetops and above, clear sky view,i spotted 2 large orbs of white light, rapidly circling eachother in a large circle, about the size of a football field.The sky was completely covered by dense clouds and the light circles were quite visible.They never waivered from their distance from eachother, but did move sideways from time to time.It resembled a planet with an orbiting planet....Not an irregular path. i watched for several minutes and then started to take photographs with my digital camera and flash.I could see nothing in the view window after they were taken,but kept shooting. suddenly, several gold orbs or lights appeared in an arc shape,appearing to flash or move.Then the clouds completely went away,revealing a totally clear sky with lots of stars. in an instant, the lights just vanished.  one of the photos i have sent has been lightened and set to very high contrast, to show the area was above the treetops.  no city lights, just sky.

at first, i thought it might be advertising beams shooting into the air, but it started at midnight and there were no beams back to earth. i called the police and they had no reports and no knowledge of any promotional beamed lighting in the area. i thought it might be northern lights or lightening,but it had a very set and regular pattern path. the gold lights were not visible to the naked eye when there was cloud cover,but the early photos showed them.
content.summary: Circling light balls and gold orb lights

content.detailedDescription:
Right after sunset on sunday, i noticed an extra-twinkly star at magnetic north over the mountains, specifically bogus basin ski resort.  the star, upon observation through binoculars was actually a central white light with a red, blue, and green light rotating around the central white light.  after noticing this first star, a friend and i used his binoculars to look at other bright "stars" around the area and surprisingly, identified at least 6-7 others identical to the first all around the sky.  occasionally, smaller white orbs could be seen separating from the colored lights and zipping around in all direction and then coming to a stand-still, then zipping around again, etc. we observed these orbs separating from three of the multicolored craft/objects.  we observed these object with his binoculars for about an hour.  after that, he went home and i watched the initial light (at magnetic north about 55 degrees from horizontal) until around 10pm when i retired to bed.  

i have noticed this extra-twinkly star over bogus basin ski resort every clear night for two weeks straight.  this was the first time i looked at it through binoculars.  it does not seem to be hiding at all and i feel very calm and happy when observing this object.  i walk home from work about four nights per week and feel like it is emitting some kind of peaceful vibration.  

i am an engineer by trade and am quite accustomed to dealing with natural phenomenon.  this was not a natural phenomena.  the colored lights did not rotate across the sky in the manner that stars or the iss do.  

i plan to purchase a telescope in the near future so that i may observe these objects in greater detail.
content.summary: Several very far-off sets of multicolored lights in different parts of the sky.

content.detailedDescription:

i have noticed this extra-twinkly star over bogus basin ski resort every clear night for two weeks straight.  this was the first time i looked at it through binoculars.  it does not seem to be hiding at all and i feel very calm and happy when observing this object.  i walk home from work about four nights per week and feel like it is emitting some kind of peaceful vibration.  

i am an engineer by trade and am quite accustomed to dealing with natural phenomenon.  this was not a natural phenomena.  the colored lights did not rotate across the sky in the manner that stars or the iss do.  

i plan to purchase a telescope in the near future so that i may observe these objects in greater detail.
content.summary: Several very far-off sets of multicolored lights in different parts of the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I'm a 33 year old male, well traveled, french nationality.
29th of november 2009 at exactly 22:09/10:09pm
belgium border with france.
little town called evregnies.
i'm constantly looking out our bay windows (south-west) on the first floor where my wife and i do most of our work, so i know the difference between helicopters, planes and sometimes hot air balloons. 
i walked in the room with the lights off and out the window was this bright golden star hovering around the tree line, brigther than the street light. i picked up my binoculars (that are right next to the windows) and took a closer look, no red or green position lights. so i thought of a plane with it's landing headlights on coming straight for me or turning. but that thought only lasted a millisecond, as the movement was erratic and the glow was stronger then a star or headlights even dead on. i didn't want to disturb my wife working in the next room, but this was it, i knew it. so i called her in, she has 20/20 eyes and can almost see at night, she's lived here all her life and after staring at it "closely" for a few moments just said :" looks like you got one".I was already snapping these. but like all true u.F.O sightings, my camera was set to 5 mega pixels instead of 10 !!!!  (it's a fujifilm finepixz)
the object slowly moved beneath the tree line (which is 100 meters (300 feet) away, south-west)and floated slightly north/north-west to finally disappear from sight over the town of wattrelos due to neighboring houses and trees. i kept a look out in that direction and then the rest of the sky for a further 15 min without any luck.
i blew-up,lightened/contrast, and use the density(-) tool in photo editing software and was blown away by the "structure" that just forms (i didn't "insist" on any particular part of the image nor did i favor any forms to bring out this structure, thus the original dark unedited image 001) , like  3 port holes with light on one side and a grill in the back with symmetry. i added the originals, the zoomed in and lightened ones and even the wobbly one, i have more but just blurry dots. on the "lightened" photos you can  see the tree line and the trees are about 20 meters high (65 feet). the backdrop is lighter due to lights from the town of wattrelos, about half a kilometer behind the house starts the belgium highway, the only one in the world to be completely lit up at night, orange. but what we saw was golden copper, no flashing colored lights, it looked like it was changing shape or morphing, pulsating in form i could say.I've traveled all my life in planes and my parents were in the airline business, i know what we saw was not a plane. it's movements were, like i said erratic, yet smooth; like if you were always falling but just never did. i felt like one would when seeing a wild animal in the brush, amazed, flabbergasted and i must admit a bit frightened. it on the other hand looked like it was looking for a place to park or sightseeing. i still have a little tingle in my chest.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.shape: Cigar,   Egg,   Fireball,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like,   Unknown
content.summary: Orange golden star like sphere, moving in a perculiar manner over the tree line.

content.detailedDescription: My 2 friends and i were driving west on washington valley rd. we came to an open area where a new rd came down a hill to a stop. at that intersection, we saw an oval flat blimp-like object, enormous, larger than a football field. it emitted a low frequency pulsing vibration. we all got out of the car and stood behind it to look at this object. it was rimmed in weird lights(now i would call them led-like) and we could feel it. we instinctively grabbed each other's hands, suddenly overcome with fright. all at once in a flash the thing took off heading east out over the valley towards bound brook. we jumped back into the car and pulled a u-turn, determined to follow it.  we drove a long way along the valley rd until it quickly became a speck in the sky. we went to the warrenville police office to report our experience. the officers made jokes about little green men, but we made them write down what we saw.. we then drove home where i told my mother the reason why i was so very late (my curfew was midnight) she was a scientist and a science teacher, but she believed us. wr were all over wrought with fear, and that night rather than sleeping in my upstairs bed, i crept downstairs and slept on the floor of my parents bedroom. i have never been as frightened as i was that night 33 years ago. the next day, she found out somehow where to get a form for us to fill out to make a formal report of our sighting to the us gov't. we did so, and she mailed it off. later we found out that our neighbor had seen this thing at the bottom of the street in the same place we had, and that another friend had seen it streak through the sky over the john's manville factory in manville nj that same night.
content.summary: Object seen low in sky by 3 witnesses

content.detailedDescription:
Witness was on his front porch turning off christmas lights before retiring for the night. as he looked up from under the porch, he saw an orange ball of light from which a smaller light came from the bottom of it and moved to the left creating another (2nd) orange light. this cycle happened 2 more times within an approximate 10 second time span. witness went inside to call his wife out, but by then, the lights had vanished.

witness described the light as being "ten o'clock high". the light was a little east of dublin and was moving from the south to the north from the witnesses perspective. witness indicated that the light in relation to speed, was "just idling along."

witness remembers that jets were "around" the light at the time. after the disapearence of the lights, the jets could still be heard. 

witness further stated  that jets dog-fight, drop chaff and flares, and perform missle-avoidance training over lake proctor very frequently.
content.summary: 4 orange lights in series

content.detailedDescription: First of all, my father an i watch the sky here 24/7. we see amazing things but this is like none other. so, its about 8:25 p.M. and my dad was taking me and my best friend to wall-mart to pick up some shorts for basketball the next day, when on the way we spotted a huge, "burning" like orb that started to drop into the trees. at first we thought it was a fire so we so we rushed to it. when we got into the woods, we couldn't find it. so we drove sown the freeway some more, and it suddenly peeked back out of the trees. we decided to go to where it was and we watched it for 2 hours. these "balls of fire" sat there, dropped and then blinked out. after it blinked out, a little white orb would come out of the "fireball" and move to the left super quick, and then to the right. lite up and then turn into a "fireball" itself. this went on for 3 hours. so, we sped home got our telescope (which we didn't have at the time) and sped back to find them gone. we sat there for 10 more minutes to watch many moving white orbs fly around the sky. i hope our town and community recognize the significance of these sightings. after the fact, we were skeptical that it was a ufo, but here a ufo crashed many years ago, so i know for a fact this sigting was not a "weather balloon, ball ligtning, blimp, flare, and other such." if it was a flare, it is unlike any flare i have seen before.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 10-20 hovering fireballs over the bay

content.detailedDescription:
I saw an object in the sky, that caught my eye. it did't look like a plane. there was a white light on it that was on. and a red and blue flashing lights. the object was moving from left to right in the sky. i started watching it and then after a few seconds the object just disappeared. i watched in the sky for 15 more minutes to see if it reappeared and i didnt see anything... no lights, nothing. a few minutes after it disappeared, i saw a plane or something come from the other direction, it had a white light, and fly right by where the other object had disappeared from.

strange. could have just been planes... but who knows...
content.summary: Blue, white and red light object, disappears.

content.detailedDescription: I had just come home from work and went into back yard to see the dogs. i looked up at the sky n-w and saw two bright lights following each other heading in a s-e direction. they were moving real fast. i watch them till they disappeared. it was like someone turned off the lights. the light was a bright white, no colors. the sighting lasted about 12 seconds.
content.summary: Two starlike lights passing

content.detailedDescription: My friend wanted to go on to the roof, of his apartment building on the corner of 10th street & 1st avenue in the east village of new york city, to see the stars and planets. it was a clear night. he was pointing out orion's belt, sirius dog stars many constellations and the planets mars & saturn. he said if we stare in this sectio, which i think was north east,  we might be able to see a shooting star. we stared for a many minutes until he said look whats that? then to the right, which i think was east of us was a black triangular craft hovering low and moving slowly away from us. all 3 of us saw it. then it turned behind a taller building across the street. we walked towards the other end of the roof to see if it would come back around. but i was very cold and scared and told them we should go inside. i would not have believed this if they hadnt seen it too. if anyone told me they saw it i would think they were crazy but all 3 of us did see it! i feel it is my duty to report this event to mufon and that everyone should know that this really did happen. on saturday november 28th 2009 myself and 2 of my friends saw a silent slow moving black triangular ufo over new york city.
content.summary: Myself and 2 of my friends saw a black triangular ufo over new york city.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving down rt 71 right before rt 76 going south and right behind me there was this bright white light followed by 4 bright flashes of blue and one of green that filled the whole sky! it looked luke the light was on the groud and went outward and was bright! did not see any object. not sure what it was...
content.summary: Bright white light followed by 4 bright flashes of blue and one of green that filled the whole sky!

content.detailedDescription:
I was at my friends house on 8th and cherry in east denver, we had just finished decorating a christmas tree.  i looked at the clock because i had to leave pretty soon - it was about 8:40 pm when i went out there.  i thought, at 9:00 pm i have to go.

i was looking towards the east and i saw what i thought must have been a satellite because it moved like that in a straight line and it was clearly very far away.  it was just a very bright dot.  i saw it move up the horizon,until it got nearly parallel with oriens' belt then it stopped! 

i thought that was odd, but then it moved to the south a little bit and then to the north a little bit and then up and then back down (east and west). the movement was sporatic.  it "scooched along" periodically in all four directions. i had my friends come outside and we all watched it zig zag (4 people between the ages of 10 and 50), it's really cold tonight so we went into get our jackets on and when we came back we couldn't find it again.  when we went back in, the clock said 9:30 pm.    

it was no phoenix lights but it was pretty darned exciting!
content.summary: Blinking orange star that moved from east to west, stops then moves again.

content.detailedDescription:
I was at my friends house on 8th and cherry in east denver, we had just finished decorating a christmas tree.  i looked at the clock because i had to leave pretty soon - it was about 8:40 pm when i went out there.  i thought, at 9:00 pm i have to go.

i was looking towards the east and i saw what i thought must have been a satellite because it moved like that in a straight line and it was clearly very far away.  it was just a very bright dot.  i saw it move up the horizon,until it got nearly parallel with oriens' belt then it stopped! 

i thought that was odd, but then it moved to the south a little bit and then to the north a little bit and then up and then back down (east and west). the movement was sporatic.  it "scooched along" periodically in all four directions. i had my friends come outside and we all watched it zig zag (4 people between the ages of 10 and 50), it's really cold tonight so we went into get our jackets on and when we came back we couldn't find it again.  when we went back in, the clock said 9:30 pm.    

it was no phoenix lights but it was pretty darned exciting!
content.summary: Blinking orange star that moved from east to west, stops then moves again...

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from oh on i-70, there was a huge traffic jam and we were moving between 5-20mph for many miles starting around mile marker 103.  traffic started to get lighter around mile marker 130 but then it started to be stop and go again around mile marker 140.  as i rounded the bend i noticed in the sky a huge saucer shaped object.  i didn't want to believe that it could be a ufo and tried to see if it was a cloud but it could not have been a cloud.  all the clouds in the sky were a feathery, thin sort of cloud (cirrus).  this object in the sky was very solid.  there were no cumulus clouds.  and the shape of this object was defined and sharp, no bumps like what cumulus clouds look like.  i noticed a lot of people pulled over in the emergency pull over areas and i tried to get my vehicle to one of those to get my camera out of my trunk but the traffic was so bad.  by the time i was able to get to an emergency pull over, the object was half way hidden by trees and when i was in park, the object was completely hidden by trees.  i started driving towards darker skies and lost sight of the object.
content.summary: Huge saucer shaped in the middle of the sky

content.detailedDescription: I was outside in my backyard  smoking a cigarette. it wasn't dark yet as it was only about 5 in the afternoon. i saw a light moving low in the sky. i thought it was a plane at first and watched it as it moved along. i thought it was a little strange that i could see the light of the plane very clearly but not the fuselage or anything else. i also discounted this to distance. i then thought that for the distance is was moving a bit faster than it should since we have a lot of air traffic around us. i continued to watch it then moved behind a tree obstructing my view as i stood stationary. i expected the object to keep on its course and be visible as it moved passed the tree. the object never be came visable again. i was confused and moved to see if it had stopped at that spot or changed course but i never saw it again. it was too high to drop below the tree line. i live on the back of a hill and was looking towards flats and the tree it disappeared behind was only 10 feet from me. there we no clouds and no stars out yet. i felt so confused and stood outside for another 10 minutes trying to figure it out.
content.summary: Flying object disappears

content.detailedDescription: Around 6 pm this evening i was driving down state route 22-3 (montgomery rd) toward landen when i saw two large, bright lights in the sky.  they immediately caught my attention.  as i drove i got closer to the object and i pulled into the mcdonalds parking lot to observe it.  i am unaware of the altitude of the object because i'm not familiar with the normal altitudes aircraft fly at.  therefore, i went by my knowledge of just seeing planes in the sky on a daily basis and determined that it was lower than a plane would normally be.  however, i cant say for sure, the object was so large it seemed that it must have been very low or it could have been higher than that but my perception was thrown off by the size of it, i do not know.  anyway, i sat in the mcdonalds parking lot just watching the object move toward my direction, i thought it was stationary from afar but after observing it for several minutes i realized it was moving very slow.  eventually it passed over my location and i observed it to be a large black triangle.  there were three lights, one in each corner. the light on the point of the triangle was dimmer in comparison to the other lights. i couldn't determine the color of the craft as it passed overhead, all i could see were the large lights.  there were no flashing lights at all on the craft.  i rolled my windows down as the craft passed very close to my location and i heard absolutely no sound, not like you normally would hear with an airplane. i watched this object until it was completely out of my view. i am truly puzzled by what i witnessed.
content.summary: Large triangular object sighted on route 22-3

content.detailedDescription: Taking picture and watching very carefully at same time for bugs or birds found unknown object in picture, don't know what it is, dosen't look like any flying bug i have ever seen.I saw nothing fly by when i took picture.
content.summary: Unknown object

content.detailedDescription: I was at lincoln financial field watching the eagles game in philadelphia.It was the 2nd quarter and we were sitting in section 210 in the end zone upper level.My father looked up in the direction of the field and said eddie (thats me)look there is a ufo.Sure enough there was a shiny silver object in the sky.It looked oval in shape and it slowed down for a second then sped up at a very high rate of speed.I could see the object moving across the sky nice and steady and smooth.It did not go up or down.Before you knew it was gone.The event lasted for less then 30 seconds.I have to admit.This is the 1st time i and my father ever saw anything like this.No one can change my mind about what i saw.I knew this was special.Yes there were other people that saw the same thing.Everyone was talking about it. it was traveling against the direction of the wind so in knew it was not a balloon.I never saw a object move through the sky the was this did.Well thats my story. i hope more people will report what they saw.
content.summary: Saw ufo at the eagles game

content.detailedDescription: While sitting on my 'starbench',top of a hill on my property (in the sf bay area), & occasionally looking up at the brilliant cosmos, i noticed 2 very bright, starlike objects, one trailing the other silently gliding from n-w to s-e, not sure how high up. these silverblue diamonds (in color, no red, no green) kept exact distance between each other as they passed. since i couldn't tell how high up they were, i couldn't calculate their speed, but it was fairly rapid. they definitely were in our atmosphere, and i hoped the 'gap' between them would be solid-- indicating 'something' of great size. but no, as they passed over, the fixed stars beyond them were visible, no light distortion. as the 2 objects passed 'beneath' the moon, they silently and quickly faded out of visibility. no high clouds or fog they could have disappeared into, moon still shining brightly. haven't seen anything this unusual since jan '74 when i was in the dc area...
content.summary: Two starlike lights passing overhead

content.detailedDescription: I went outside to have a smoke. as usual i was staring at the sky. i looked up to see a star like object traversing the sky. i watched it just glide across the sky. no acceleration or movement really. i went inside to grab the binoculars to get a better look at the thing. when observed from a "closer" range, it appeared solid white. when i looked at it when it was further away, it looked almost like an orange pink color. i thought to myself that it had to be a satellite. i eventually lost sight of it after about 5-6 minutes. just to note, there was alot of traffic in the sky. it seemed to me they were putting in alot of chemtrail work.
content.summary: Watched "star" move across sky

content.detailedDescription: On june 10,2005 at 4:30 in the afternoon i was installing vinyl siding on a garage on 10th street in middletown,indiana a few miles east of anderson. as i was cutting a piece of j-channel, out of the corner of my eye i saw a flash in the sky nearly overhead at about a 75 or 80 degree angle to the west.It was sunny with a few clouds so i assumed it was just the sun reflecting off an airplane as it passed. when i looked up at where the flash had been there was a silver metallic looking sphere moving south at about the speed of a small airplane. i have never seen anything like it in the sky before, and i've been doing roofing and siding for 19 years so i look at the sky much more than average. i kept my eyes on it as it flew directly south for about ten seconds until it entered a small ball shaped cloud. the cloud was small enough that the sphere should have come out the other side in three to four seconds, but it never came back out in over ten minutes that i stared at the cloud. all the clouds including the one the sphere entered were all drifting directly to the east, so the sphere wasn't moving with the wind like a balloon would. from the size of the sphere being at cloud level i would guess it's size to be between fifteen and twenty-five feet. it appeared to be made of brushed stainless steel and had no markings of any kind on it. since that day four and a half years ago i've tried to find some example of what i saw on the internet but the only thing that looks like it is the pictures and videos of silver spheres shown on ufo websites. i included a picture i found on the internet of what it looked like and i've kept a camera and binoculars with me ever since in the hope of seeing one again.
content.summary: Silver sphere over middletown in
